intro: Dichromena killipii, commonly known as the Killip's dichromena, is a flowering plant native to the island of Socotra. It is characterized by its unique, spirally arranged leaves and small, white or pale blue flowers. The plant belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related species. Dichromena killipii is adapted to the arid and semi-arid environments of Socotra, exhibiting features such as succulent leaves for water storage. Its botanical significance lies in its distinct morphology and its role in the unique flora of the island.
